column4: i have just install ubuntu and now i am getting grub error 17 at boot.  How do i go about fixing this on that computer
have you tried to google Grub 17?... its getting pretty common..
Yeah i am fishing through some forums right now
how is your current hardware setup, and how did you install Ubuntu?
i suspect what happened(just guessing), is Grub was installed to the wrong drive.  Try goign to your bios, and changing the boot order of the drives.
I think i tried that.  I will try it again, maybe it didnt save my settings
are you on a RAID with those two drives
it was trying to boot the correct drive, the other drive prompts me to reboot.  No i am not on raid
hmm, just make sure i understand your setup right, . 2 hard drives, 1 has Windows installed one big partition, Drive 2, has 1 windows partition, and an Ubuntu partition.
hmm, i wonder if grub somehow got put on the wrong windows partition?
so you have 4 OS's?  What OS's?
why do you have two copies of win2k?  and why on earth woudl you have winme?  thats like a big windows virus.
the win2k must remain seperate, and i am unsure of winme at this time
sorry, i've never setup Ubuntu to boot multiple Windows Distros, and Ubuntu, I've booted Windows XP, and multiple linux distros, n prob.
